description.narrative: Stöd till Life and Peace Institute's Peacebuilding program 2010-2012. LPI jobbar med civilsamhället och hjälper konfliktcenter att analysera och hantera komplexa konfliktdynamiker på olika nivåer, samt mobilisering av aktörer som kan komma att ha positiv inverkan i deras transformationsarbete.

Support to Life and Peace Institute's Peacebuilding Programmes 2013-2016. LPI works with civil society actors and help creates conflict transformation centres to analyse and manage complex conflict dynamics at different levels, as well as mobilising actors likely to play a positive and complementary role in their transformation/resolution.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Over the past four years of implementation, the Horn of Africa Regional Programme has evolved in to an effective regional actor with substantial added value in working with policy makers, influencers and the civil society in general. It has managed to foster workable partnerships with key regional players; governmental, intergovernmental (IGAD and AU), and other CSOs. It has been realized that influencing policy making in the region comes from sustained engagement in policy discourse and relationship building. In this regard, the programme has managed to institutionalize its engagement with the African Union and IGAD (memorandum of understanding signed in 2015 and 2016 respectively), which are the key entry points for regional policy making. In addition the programme has broadened its reach to the civil society, academia, the private sector, and other segments of the society in the effort to promote locally-led and participatory processes to work on a pertinent regional policy issues.
Moreover, the programme has facilitated establishment of collaborative platforms, both formal and informal, so as to foster cross fertilization of conflict transformation theory and practices. In this regard, it has established a 'quartet' forum comprised of IGAD, Inter Africa Group, Organization for Social Science Research in Eastern and Southern Africa (OSSREA), and LPI to work on a collaborative policy engagement pilot focusing on the nexus between informal cross border trade and cross border security governance. Furthermore, the Horn of Africa Bulletin (HAB), the quarterly publication of the programme, and its Forum has transformed into an important policy discourse platform bringing together representatives of the governments, academia, and practitioners discussing on key policy issues in the region.
The programme has also played catalytic role in enhancing the capacities of peacebuilding civil society organizations and local communities through trainings in peacebuilding advocacy, developing advocacy strategies, and policy engagement activities.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
